update.description:
I created a tool that automatically computes the 3D mesh geometry parameters, such as the volume, center of mass and inertia, and also cleans up the mesh by performing the duplicate vertex and face removal and removal of non manifold faces. Internally the tool simply runs meshlab (i.e. meshlabserver). 

I am using this tool for a while now, and I think it would definitely be a good asset to the Gazebo community.
update.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

content.raw: Aha, good to know that, I was not sure how Gazebo handles this. Ok, as I said, I like to keep things decluttered, so to that end I have created a tool that lets you visualize and rescale models so that you can then simply use the scaled model to get all the inertia parameters. This is the tool for that: https://www.hamzamerzic.info/3d_viz/
content.html: Aha, good to know that, I was not sure how Gazebo handles this. Ok, as I said, I like to keep things decluttered, so to that end I have created a tool that lets you visualize and rescale models so that you can then simply use the scaled model to get all the inertia parameters. This is the tool for that: https://www.hamzamerzic.info/3d_viz/

pull_request.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

pullrequest.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

content.raw:
The tool works well for me, I think it's nice to have it listed on the tutorial. Approved. Please do leave a note here when you make the code public, just in case people have feedback. And also let us know if you plan on taking the website down.

Regarding volume, I can't think of a way to compensate for the mesh scale unless I calculate by hand after running your tool. See the two cones below, the one on the right is scaled 10x to have a reasonable size next to the car, while the one on the left has the original scale, they both use the inertia from your tool.

![cones.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RMMxjX/images/2542072818-cones.png)
content.html:
The tool works well for me, I think it's nice to have it listed on the tutorial. Approved. Please do leave a note here when you make the code public, just in case people have feedback. And also let us know if you plan on taking the website down.

Regarding volume, I can't think of a way to compensate for the mesh scale unless I calculate by hand after running your tool. See the two cones below, the one on the right is scaled 10x to have a reasonable size next to the car, while the one on the left has the original scale, they both use the inertia from your tool.

pull_request.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

pullrequest.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

content.raw:
Again, grateful for the remarks. I fixed the inertia thing. Regarding the scaling, I hate clutter and would like to provide the most simplistic functionality, so I would prefer to leave the volume computation to the users, unless it affects center of mass and inertia computations, which, I assume, Gazebo handles internally? 
Another great suggestion regarding the Gazebo community - thank you! Do you know what the next steps would be in order to get this PR approved?
content.html: Again, grateful for the remarks. I fixed the inertia thing. Regarding the scaling, I hate clutter and would like to provide the most simplistic functionality, so I would prefer to leave the volume computation to the users, unless it affects center of mass and inertia computations, which, I assume, Gazebo handles internally? Another great suggestion regarding the Gazebo community - thank you! Do you know what the next steps would be in order to get this PR approved?

pull_request.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

pullrequest.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

content.raw:
Awesome, thanks for the quick replies! I now get the SDF and the update button is working. Some other comments/suggestions:

* The closing `</inertia>` tag is missing the `/`
* The [construction_cone](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/src/4b4490dc9e93/construction_cone/?at=default) mesh is scaled up 10 times when inserted into Gazebo. When I get the inertial properties, the volume is based on the original mesh though, so it ends up very small. You could consider adding an optional scale field so the user can adjust the volume.
* You could announce the tool on https://community.gazebosim.org/ so more people in the community are aware of your great tool :smile:
content.html:
Awesome, thanks for the quick replies! I now get the SDF and the update button is working. Some other comments/suggestions:

  • The closing </inertia> tag is missing the /
  • The construction_cone mesh is scaled up 10 times when inserted into Gazebo. When I get the inertial properties, the volume is based on the original mesh though, so it ends up very small. You could consider adding an optional scale field so the user can adjust the volume.
  • You could announce the tool on https://community.gazebosim.org/ so more people in the community are aware of your great tool

content.raw: Those are some great suggestions @chapulina I included your feature request, please check it out. The code is a bit intertwined with the web at this stage, but I will make it public once I decouple things. :) The update button should now work as well, thanks for reporting that.
content.html: Those are some great suggestions @chapulina I included your feature request, please check it out. The code is a bit intertwined with the web at this stage, but I will make it public once I decouple things. :) The update button should now work as well, thanks for reporting that.

pull_request.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

pullrequest.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

content.raw:
Nice! The coke can now works for me! A couple of other issues I noticed:

* Many (most?) of the other meshes on the model database are not "watertight" so we don't get results. For example, the `ambulance`, `bowl`... Not a problem with your tool, I think we should clean up those meshes.
* For the meshes that work, I first get results with mass == 1.0, but when I change the mass and click "Update", I don't get any results

I have a feature request, is the code publicly available somewhere with an issue tracker? :) I think it would be convenient if the output was already formatted in SDF, for example for the coke can:

~~~
<inertial>
  <!-- Volume: 6.6642197270e-03 -->
  <pose>-1.1383210000e-02    -1.3927920000e-02     6.1967289000e-01 0 0 0</pose>
  <mass>1.0</mass>
  <inertia>
    <ixx> 9.1921404545e-03</ixx>
    ...
  </inertia>
</inertial>
~~~
content.html:
Nice! The coke can now works for me! A couple of other issues I noticed:

  • Many (most?) of the other meshes on the model database are not "watertight" so we don't get results. For example, the ambulance, bowl... Not a problem with your tool, I think we should clean up those meshes.
  • For the meshes that work, I first get results with mass == 1.0, but when I change the mass and click "Update", I don't get any results

I have a feature request, is the code publicly available somewhere with an issue tracker? :) I think it would be convenient if the output was already formatted in SDF, for example for the coke can:

<inertial>
  <!-- Volume: 6.6642197270e-03 -->
  <pose>-1.1383210000e-02    -1.3927920000e-02     6.1967289000e-01 0 0 0</pose>
  <mass>1.0</mass>
  <inertia>
    <ixx> 9.1921404545e-03</ixx>
    ...
  </inertia>
</inertial>

content.raw: @chapulina I think I have fixed it now. May I ask you to test it again? The result will be without textures.
content.html: @chapulina I think I have fixed it now. May I ask you to test it again? The result will be without textures.

pull_request.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

pullrequest.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

content.raw:
Hi @chapulina,

Thank you very much for your comment. It seems like all the problems come from the fact that the meshes which you are trying to clean contain textures. Meshlabserver seems to crash because of this. It is funny how none of my test meshes had any texture. Thanks again for testing it out - I will do my best to figure out how to deal with this soon.
content.html:
Hi @chapulina,

Thank you very much for your comment. It seems like all the problems come from the fact that the meshes which you are trying to clean contain textures. Meshlabserver seems to crash because of this. It is funny how none of my test meshes had any texture. Thanks again for testing it out - I will do my best to figure out how to deal with this soon.

pullrequest.title: Link to tool for automatic mesh geometry computation and cleanup.

content.raw:
Hi @hamzamerzic , thanks for working on this tool!

I tried out some meshes from the model database such as [this one](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/src/4b4490dc9e938b42d2e9c8c7cce1bad177ad65f5/coke_can/meshes/coke_can.dae?fileviewer=file-view-default) but I never get to see the volume, CoM and inertia as described. Am I doing something wrong? I tried both Firefox and Chrome. I also noticed that DAE meshes seem to be uploaded correctly, but OBJ meshes don't.

![meshcleaner.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RMMxjX/images/1647257437-meshcleaner.png)
content.html:
Hi @hamzamerzic , thanks for working on this tool!

I tried out some meshes from the model database such as this one but I never get to see the volume, CoM and inertia as described. Am I doing something wrong? I tried both Firefox and Chrome. I also noticed that DAE meshes seem to be uploaded correctly, but OBJ meshes don't.
